result.execSummary:
The defendant Clay Adam Bopp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Clay Adam Bopp is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Clay Adam Bopp was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Certification of WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING/PLEA HEARING transcript commencing 11/16/2015 received and filed. (17 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to:
Attorney Christopher Sobic
State of Wisconsin Public Defender
Appellate Division
735 N. Water Street, Ste 912 E
Milwaukee, WI 53202-4116

Defendant Clay Adam Bopp in court PRO SE.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Per Order signed on 1/28/2016:  probation term on count two is commuted to one (1) year.
Signed, Filed, and Distributed, Order Commuting Probation Term.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify probation term on count two.

Defendant Clay Adam Bopp in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Court ordered defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, which can be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System, consecutive to 15CF4901, with credit for 14 days time served. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-AODA assessment, comply with current/any recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Christina P unless approved by the agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Filed: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Case adjourned to branch 24 for a Probation Review Hearing.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Clay Adam Bopp in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to dismiss is granted by the Court without prejudice.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Statements made by Christina P.  Court ordered the child removed from the no contact order.  No contact with Christina P. and Michele M. remains in effect.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Any positive test will result in higher cash bail.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $500.00.

Defendant Clay Adam Bopp in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Clay Adam Bopp in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Due to the assignment of the ADA, this case is retabbed to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CHRISTINA P.(12/30/79), A.B. (4/3/00), OR THEIR RESIDENCE AND MICHELE M. (5/6/77) OR HER RESIDENCE.  
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Clay Adam Bopp in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Clay Adam Bopp in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 04.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
